basics.name: Yu Otsubo
basics.label: Fullcycle Tech Lead
basics.summary:
I'm a Software and Infrastructure developer with over 9+ years, and I've been leading some engineering teams in recent years. 
Expert at AWS by using Server-less architecture.
Also a master of Server-side API and Batch with Python.
Additionally, experienced data science with Python and AWS.
I have lectured at AWS Summit Tokyo 19 with company booth.

Integrate monitoring and operation system using by Zabbix and Expect

Formulate and execute missions and projects for the Product Infrastructure team as Development Manager.

work.summary: I develop AI agent applications leveraging generative AI technologies.
highlights: Currently serving as the development lead for "A-BOSS" an AI agent created specifically for sales organizations.

awards.title: Award of technology quality improvement annually
awards.summary: Stable and flexible system design utilizing AWS and successfully responded to large-scale traffic without problems.

publications.name: KAG Tech Book -Vol1-
publications.summary: This book was written by volunteers from KDDI Agile Development Center, Inc. Each of them brought their experiences and knowledge gained while working on different sites and products, and compiled their practices and learnings as a team into a single book.As a result, the content of this book is not limited to a single point of view, but is a mixture of various approaches and ways of thinking. We would be more than happy if any of the chapters could be a hint for the challenges you are facing now or will be tackling in the future.

publications.name: やさしいMCP入門
publications.summary: An introductory guide to MCP (Model Context Protocol), the standard for the AI agent era. The author of the wildly popular slides “Gentle Introduction to MCP” gently explains the fundamentals of this new technology.

publications.name: AIエージェント開発 / 運用入門 [生成AI深掘りガイド]
publications.summary: Learn everything about AI agents—the basics, how to build them, and how to use them—all in one book!This comprehensive introductory guide thoroughly explains the fundamentals of AI agents, the hot topic of recent years, step by step from the very basics. It covers essential foundational knowledge, how to build AI agents, real-world use cases, and even Large Language Models (LLMs), which are indispensable when discussing AI agents. The authors are three leading experts in AI application development: Minoru Oda (Tech Evangelist, KDDI Agile Development Center), Yu Otsubo (Software Engineer, KDDI Agile Development Center), and Maki Tsukada (Engineer, AI Strategy Project Group, Mitsubishi Electric). Together, they provide a comprehensive guide covering everything from the fundamentals of LLMs and generative AI to cutting-edge use cases and the latest API implementation methods. The book also provides detailed guidance on how to actually develop AI agents. Reading this book allows you to master the fundamentals of Amazon Bedrock, Claude, LangChain, and LangGraph, enabling you to broadly and thoroughly learn the key technologies for AI agent development. Furthermore, the latter part of the book introduces practical techniques usable in real development environments. It covers AI agent development methods using the recently popular “Mastra” (an AI development framework) and explains post-development operational phase techniques (LLMOps) using Langfuse, taking you directly to a practical level.

interests.name: Photograph
keywords: Take photos in metropolis night view

projects.name: The chat-bot service for customer support(Web)
projects.description:
The chat-bot that solves the problems of customers for telecommunications companies.
This chat-bot service is a hybrid architecture of chat-bots and human operators, labor saving and improved customer satisfaction were achieved at the same time.
And also, adopting Elasticsearch as a FAQ search engine and using it in combination with other AI engines achieves a high response rate.
I was Experienced roles on Primary Developer, Data scientist for making FAQ engine and Scrum master for the team.
highlights: A chat-bot in Web page
Hybrid arch with chat-bot and human operators
Use Elasticsearch for FAQ search engine
roles: Data scientist for making FAQ engine

projects.name: The chatbot service for customer support(Native Apps)
projects.description:
As a chatbot enhancement project created in FY2018, we have made it possible to respond in the same way not only on web pages but also on customer support apps created on Android and iOS.
Like the previous time, it uses a Docker container and AWS managed services, and is structured to be aware of the microarchitecture.
In this architecture, Node.js is used as a server for Backends For Frontends to communicate with customers using apps using Websocket. It uses Python for Backend.
The architecture was presented at AWS Summit Tokyo 2019.
highlights: A chatbot in Native App
Hybrid arch with chatbot and human operators
Featured at AWS Summit Tokyo

projects.name: A-BOSS (AI Business Department Manager)
projects.description: Developed an advanced AI agent called A-BOSS that functions as a virtual department manager to support sales activities at KDDI. The system automatically reviews business proposals from a department manager's perspective and provides comprehensive support across all aspects of sales operations. Built on Amazon Bedrock with Agentic Workflow technology, A-BOSS represents a production implementation of LLMOps (Large Language Model Operations). The system features adaptive learning capabilities that allow it to become increasingly intelligent with continued usage.
highlights: Developed an AI agent that provides department manager-level guidance to sales teams
Implemented Amazon Bedrock with Agentic Workflow architecture
Created a production-grade LLMOps system with continuous learning capabilities
Integrated with existing sales support systems for seamless workflow
Featured in KDDI's official corporate communications
